thread.title: White House visitors go camera crazy after 40-year ban is lifted
thread.title_full: White House visitors go camera crazy after 40-year ban is lifted

title: White House visitors go camera crazy after 40-year ban is lifted
text:
White House visitors go camera crazy after 40-year ban is lifted Caption White House allows picture-taking during tours Susan Walsh, Associated Press 
People take photos of first dog Bo while touring the White House in Washington, July 1. The White House on Wednesday ended a long-standing ban on tourists taking photos or using social media during public tours of the building. 
People take photos of first dog Bo while touring the White House in Washington, July 1. The White House on Wednesday ended a long-standing ban on tourists taking photos or using social media during public tours of the building. (Susan Walsh, Associated Press) Caption White House allows picture-taking during tours Susan Walsh, Associated Press 
A group has their photo taken in front of a portrait of President John F. Kennedy hanging in the Cross Hall while touring the White House in Washington. 
A group has their photo taken in front of a portrait of President John F. Kennedy hanging in the Cross Hall while touring the White House in Washington. (Susan Walsh, Associated Press) 
After the White House on Wednesday ended a long-standing, 40-year ban on tourists taking photos or using social media during public tours of the building, visitors went a little camera crazy. Loading
